context_of_use: A registered fan uses the system to follow specific teams and players in order to receive updates about those entities.
stakeholders_and_interests: Fan: Wants to follow favorite teams and players to stay up to date on what is happening.
IFA: Wants fans to engage with teams and players through the system to increase transparency and usage.
Teams: Want fans to follow them and their players to improve engagement and communication.
Players: Want fans to follow them to maintain a direct communication and engagement channel.
System Owner: Wants consistent, performant operation when many fans follow entities and receive updates.
description: This use case describes how a fan authenticates to the system and selects specific teams and players to follow so that the fan can receive subsequent updates about those entities.
triggering_event: A fan decides to follow one or more teams or players in the system to receive updates about them.
preconditions: The fan has a valid fan account registered in the system.
The fan has access to the system user interface (web or mobile application).
The Authentication Service is available to verify fan credentials.
The teams and players to be followed are already registered and visible in the system.
postconditions: The fan is authenticated in the system for the current session.
The selected teams are recorded in the system as entities followed by the fan.
The selected players are recorded in the system as entities followed by the fan.
The system is configured to deliver updates about the followed teams and players to the fan according to existing notification capabilities.
assumptions: It is assumed that the fan has already completed a separate registration use case prior to using this use case.
It is assumed that the "authenticate" included use case represents the standard login process using existing credentials and does not add new authentication mechanisms beyond what already exists.
It is assumed that a fan can follow multiple teams and multiple players without a specified upper limit, as no limit is defined in the requirement text.
It is assumed that unfollowing entities is handled in a separate use case and is not part of this use case.

It is assumed that notification delivery about followed entities is handled by an existing notification use case; this use case only establishes the following relationship between the fan and the entities.
It is assumed that both teams and players are modeled as entities which can be searched and selected within the system interface.
It is assumed that the same following mechanism is applied to both teams and players, as the requirement text treats them equivalently with respect to following.
It is assumed that the fan accesses the system via an authenticated interactive session (e.g., web browser or mobile app) that supports viewing and selecting entities.
It is assumed that the system persists following relationships immediately so that subsequent updates can be associated with the fan without delay.
requirements_met: The system shall allow a fan to follow one or more favorite teams so that the fan can keep up to date on what is happening with those teams.
The system shall allow a fan to follow one or more favorite players so that the fan can keep up to date on what is happening with those players.
The system shall require the fan to be authenticated before the fan can configure which teams and players to follow.
The system shall store a persistent association between the authenticated fan and each followed team.
The system shall store a persistent association between the authenticated fan and each followed player.
The system shall make the list of currently followed teams and players available to the fan during subsequent sessions.
The system shall use the stored fan–entity following associations as the basis for determining which teams’ and players’ updates are relevant for that fan.
outstanding_issues: The maximum number of teams and players a single fan may follow concurrently has not been defined.
The exact types of updates (e.g., game events, schedule changes, social media posts) that a fan receives for followed entities are not specified.
Whether following entities automatically enables all notification channels or requires separate notification preference configuration is not defined.
The required performance and latency thresholds for updating and retrieving the list of followed entities are not specified.
Rules for handling entities that become inactive or are removed (e.g., retired players, disbanded teams) while being followed by fans are not specified.
main_flow: 1. Fan initiates access to the system user interface to follow entities → System displays the entry screen with options to authenticate.

2. Fan provides authentication credentials according to the included "authenticate" use case → System verifies the credentials using the Authentication Service and establishes an authenticated fan session.
3. Fan selects the option to manage followed entities (teams and players) → System displays the fan’s current list of followed teams and players and available search/browse options.
4. Fan searches for or browses available teams to follow → System retrieves and presents a list of teams that match the fan’s search or browsing criteria.

5. Fan selects one or more teams from the presented list to follow and confirms the selection → System records the selected teams as followed by the authenticated fan and updates the displayed list of followed teams.
6. Fan searches for or browses available players to follow → System retrieves and presents a list of players that match the fan’s search or browsing criteria.

7. Fan selects one or more players from the presented list to follow and confirms the selection → System records the selected players as followed by the authenticated fan and updates the displayed list of followed players.

8. Fan reviews the updated combined list of followed teams and players → System confirms successful configuration of followed entities and maintains the associations for use in future updates to the fan.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 4): Fan chooses to skip following teams and only follow players. Condition: Fan is not interested in following any teams at this time. Flow: Fan skips searching or browsing teams and directly selects the option to search for players → System bypasses team selection and proceeds to Step 6 for player search and selection → Use case then continues from Step 6.

AF-2 (from Step 6): Fan chooses to skip following players and only follow teams. Condition: Fan is not interested in following any players at this time. Flow: Fan skips searching or browsing players and directly reviews the list of followed teams → System bypasses player selection and proceeds to Step 8 for review of followed entities (which in this case consists only of teams) → Use case then completes at Step 8.

AF-3 (from Step 5): Fan modifies existing followed teams instead of only adding new ones. Condition: Fan decides to change the set of followed teams. Flow: Fan deselects one or more currently followed teams and selects additional teams before confirming → System updates the stored associations by removing deselected teams and adding newly selected teams, then updates the displayed list of followed teams → Use case then continues from Step 6.

AF-4 (from Step 7): Fan modifies existing followed players instead of only adding new ones. Condition: Fan decides to change the set of followed players. Flow: Fan deselects one or more currently followed players and selects additional players before confirming → System updates the stored associations by removing deselected players and adding newly selected players, then updates the displayed list of followed players → Use case then continues from Step 8.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 2): Authentication fails. Condition: The provided fan credentials are invalid, expired, or cannot be verified. Flow: System rejects the login attempt, displays an error message indicating that authentication failed, and offers the fan options to retry authentication or cancel the operation → If the fan retries, the flow returns to Step 2; if the fan cancels, the use case terminates without establishing or changing any followed entities.

EF-2 (from Step 4): Entity search for teams fails. Condition: A system error occurs or no teams can be retrieved based on the search or browsing request. Flow: System displays an error message indicating that teams cannot be retrieved at this time and logs the error for operational review → System allows the fan to retry the search or return to the followed entities overview; if the fan returns without successful retrieval, the use case continues from Step 6 for potential player selection.

EF-3 (from Step 6): Entity search for players fails. Condition: A system error occurs or no players can be retrieved based on the search or browsing request. Flow: System displays an error message indicating that players cannot be retrieved at this time and logs the error for operational review → System allows the fan to retry the search or return to the followed entities overview; if the fan returns without successful retrieval, the use case continues from Step 8 with the current set of followed teams only.

EF-4 (from Steps 5 or 7): Persisting follow relationships fails. Condition: A storage or network error prevents recording the fan’s selected entities as followed. Flow: System notifies the fan that the changes to followed entities could not be saved, logs the error, and preserves the previously stored following configuration unchanged → System offers the fan the option to retry saving; if the fan retries and the operation succeeds, the flow resumes at Step 8; if the fan cancels, the use case terminates with the prior following configuration intact.
information_for_steps: 1. Fan identifier (if available from previous session), entry point type (web or mobile).
2. Authentication credentials (e.g., username, password, or existing token), authentication status, session identifier.
3. Fan profile identifier, current list of followed teams, current list of followed players, manage-followed-entities view configuration.
4. Team search criteria (e.g., team name, league, region), list of teams matching criteria, team identifiers and display attributes.
5. Selected team identifiers, confirmation action, updated set of followed team identifiers associated with the fan.
6. Player search criteria (e.g., player name, team, position), list of players matching criteria, player identifiers and display attributes.
7. Selected player identifiers, confirmation action, updated set of followed player identifiers associated with the fan.
8. Final combined list of followed team identifiers and followed player identifiers for the fan, confirmation message content.
